alert.note: Alert for Central Coast; North Coast (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 25 at 10:46AM PST until December 25 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor coastal flooding. Inundation of up to two feet above ground level is possible along shorelines and low-lying coastal areas. * WHERE...North Coast and Central Coast zones, including areas around La Push and Westport. * WHEN...Until 1 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Minor coastal flooding due to tidal overflow is expected around high tide. This may lead to flooding of parking lots, parks, and roads, with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide is occuring or will occur within the next hour, and is likely being enhanced by the large waves. This may lead to lingering minor tidal overflow impacts for an hour or two after high tide.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inundation above ground level refers to the height above the Mean Higher High Water (MHHW) level.
